dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 2732 IH: Eliminating Abusive and Rampant Neglect of Interactive Technologies Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Wagner (for herself, Ms. Garcia of Texas, Mr. Owens, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Moore of Utah, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Smith of Missouri, and Mr. Calvert) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To protect victims of online child sexual abuse, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Eliminating Abusive and Rampant Neglect of Interactive Technologies Act of 2023 or the EARN IT Act of 2023.

section.header: Protecting victims of online child sexual abuse
section.text: Section 230(e) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 230(e)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: No effect on child sexual exploitation law
paragraph.text: Nothing in this section (other than subsection (c)(2)(A)) shall be construed to impair or limit—

subparagraph.text: any claim in a civil action brought against a provider of an interactive computer service under section 2255 of title 18, United States Code, if the conduct underlying the claim constitutes a violation of section 2252 or section 2252A of that title;

any charge in a criminal prosecution brought against a provider of an interactive computer service under State law regarding the advertisement, promotion, presentation, distribution, or solicitation of child sexual abuse material, as defined in section 2256(8) of title 18, United States Code; or

any claim in a civil action brought against a provider of an interactive computer service under State law regarding the advertisement, promotion, presentation, distribution, or solicitation of child sexual abuse material, as defined in section 2256(8) of title 18, United States Code.

Notwithstanding paragraph (6), none of the following actions or circumstances shall serve as an independent basis for liability of a provider of an interactive computer service for a claim or charge described in that paragraph:

clause.text: The provider utilizes full end-to-end encrypted messaging services, device encryption, or other encryption services.
The provider does not possess the information necessary to decrypt a communication.
The provider fails to take an action that would otherwise undermine the ability of the provider to offer full end-to-end encrypted messaging services, device encryption, or other encryption services.

subparagraph.text: Nothing in subparagraph (A) shall be construed to prohibit a court from considering evidence of actions or circumstances described in that subparagraph if the evidence is otherwise admissible.

section.header: Use of term child sexual abuse material

subsection.text: It is the sense of Congress that the term child sexual abuse material has the same legal meaning as the term child pornography, as that term was used in Federal statutes and case law before the date of enactment of this Act.

paragraph.text: Chapter 65 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 6502(a)(2)(B), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and
in section 6504(c)(2)(F), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: The Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 101 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 307(b)(3)(D) (6 U.S.C. 187(b)(3)(D)), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and
in section 890A (6 U.S.C. 473)—

clause.text: in subsection (b)(2)(A)(ii), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and
in subsection (e)(3)(B)(ii), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: Section 101(a)(43)(I) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(43)(I)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.
Section 3011(c) of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5710(c)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.
Section 214(a)(2) of the Broadband Data Improvement Act (15 U.S.C. 6554(a)(2)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.
Section 4(b)(2)(B) of the CAN–SPAM Act of 2003 (15 U.S.C. 7703(b)(2)(B)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.
Title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subclause.text: in subsection (b)—

subparagraph.text: in section 3632(d)(4)(D)(xlii), by striking material constituting or containing child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: Section 583(a)(2)(B) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1583(a)(2)(B)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: Section 4121 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7131) is amended—

paragraph.header: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968
paragraph.text: Section 3031(b)(3) of title I of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (34 U.S.C. 10721(b)(3)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.header: Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974
paragraph.text: Section 404(b)(1)(K) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11293(b)(1)(K)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (i)(I)(aa), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and
in clause (ii), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: Section 1402(d)(6)(A) of the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 (34 U.S.C. 20101(d)(6)(A)) is amended by striking Child Pornography Victims Reserve and inserting Reserve for Victims of Child Sexual Abuse Material.

paragraph.header: Victims of Child Abuse Act of 1990
paragraph.text: The Victims of Child Abuse Act of 1990 (34 U.S.C. 20301 et seq.) is amended—

in section 214(b) (34 U.S.C. 20304(b))—

by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and

subparagraph.text: in section 226(c)(6) (34 U.S.C. 20341(c)(6)), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.header: Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act
paragraph.text: Section 111 of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (34 U.S.C. 20911) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3)(B)(iii), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and
in paragraph (7)(G), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.header: Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006
paragraph.text: Section 143(b)(3) of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (34 U.S.C. 20942(b)(3)) is amended by striking child pornography and enticement cases and inserting cases involving child sexual abuse material and enticement of children.
The PROTECT Our Children Act of 2008 (34 U.S.C. 21101 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: Section 471(a)(20)(A)(i) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 671(a)(20)(A)(i)) is amended by striking child pornography and inserting offenses involving child sexual abuse material.
Section 101 of the Privacy Protection Act of 1980 (42 U.S.C. 2000aa) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(1), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and
in subsection (b)(1), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: Section 658H(c)(1) of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 9858f(c)(1)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D)(iii), by striking child pornography and inserting offenses relating to child sexual abuse material; and
in subparagraph (E), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: Title II of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 201 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 223 (47 U.S.C. 223)—

in subparagraph (B), in the undesignated matter following clause (ii), by striking child pornography and inserting which constitutes child sexual abuse material; and

clause.text: in subsection (d)(1), in the undesignated matter following subparagraph (B), by striking child pornography and inserting that constitutes child sexual abuse material; and

subparagraph.text: in section 254(h) (47 U.S.C. 254(h))—

clause.text: in paragraph (5)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (B)(i)(II), by striking child pornography and inserting child sexual abuse material; and

subclause.text: in the subparagraph heading, by striking Child pornography and inserting Child sexual abuse material; and

paragraph.text: The table of sections for chapter 110 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking the item relating to section 2252A and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 2252A. Certain activities relating to child sexual abuse material.

subparagraph.text: by striking the item relating to section 2258C and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 2258C. Use of technical elements from reports made to the CyberTipline to combat child sexual abuse material.

subparagraph.text: by striking the item relating to section 2259A and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 2259A. Assessments in cases involving child sexual abuse material.

subparagraph.text: by striking the item relating to section 2259B and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 2259B. Reserve for victims of child sexual abuse material.

paragraph.text: The table of sections for chapter 117 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 2427 and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 2427. Inclusion of offenses relating to child sexual abuse material in definition of sexual activity for which any person can be charged with a criminal offense.

subsection.header: Amendment to the Federal sentencing guidelines
subsection.text: Pursuant to its authority under section 994(p) of title 28, United States Code, and in accordance with this section, the United States Sentencing Commission shall amend the Federal sentencing guidelines, including application notes, to replace the terms child pornography and child pornographic material with child sexual abuse material.
The amendments made by this section to title 18 of the United States Code shall apply to conduct that occurred before, on, or after the date of enactment of this Act.
Chapter 110 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 2258A, as amended by section 6(b) of this Act—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)(B)(ii), by inserting after facts or circumstances the following: , including any available facts or circumstances sufficient to identify and locate each minor and each involved individual,; and
in paragraph (2)(A)—

subclause.text: by inserting 1591 (if the violation involves a minor), before 2251,; and
by striking or 2260 and inserting 2260, or 2422(b);

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)—

subclause.text: by inserting or location after identity; and
by striking other identifying information, and inserting other information which may identify or locate the involved individual,;

clause.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (5) as paragraphs (3) through (6), respectively;
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

paragraph.text: Information relating to the identity or location of any involved minor, which may, to the extent reasonably practicable, include the electronic mail address, Internet Protocol address, uniform resource locator, or any other information which may identify or locate any involved minor, including self-reported identifying information.

clause.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: When in its discretion a provider voluntarily includes any content described in this subsection in a report to the CyberTipline, the provider shall use best efforts to ensure that the report conforms with the structure of the CyberTipline.

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(5)(B)—

clause.text: in clause (i), by striking forwarded and inserting made available; and
in clause (ii), by striking forwarded and inserting made available;

paragraph.text: in section 2258B—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)—

clause.text: by striking arising from the performance and inserting the following:

quoted-block.text: , may not be brought in any Federal or State court if the claim or charge is directly attributable to—

paragraph.text: the performance

clause.text: in paragraph (1), as so designated, by striking may not be brought in any Federal or State court. and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: transmitting, distributing, or mailing child sexual abuse material to any Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency, or giving such agency access to child sexual abuse material, in response to a search warrant, court order, or other legal process issued by such agency; or
research voluntarily undertaken by the provider or domain name registrar using any material being preserved under section 2258A(h), if the research is only for the purpose of—

subparagraph.text: improving or facilitating reporting under this section, section 2258A, or section 2258C; or
stopping the online sexual exploitation of children.
in subsection (b)(2)(C)—

clause.text: by striking the performance of;
by inserting described in or performed after function; and
by striking this section, sections and inserting this section or section; and

paragraph.text: in section 2258C, as amended by section 6(b) of this Act—

subparagraph.text: in the section heading, by striking the CyberTipline and inserting NCMEC;
in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)—

subclause.text: by striking NCMEC and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: NCMEC

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), as so designated, by inserting or submission to the child victim identification program described in section 404(b)(1)(K)(ii) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11293(b)(1)(K)(ii)) after CyberTipline report; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: NCMEC may provide hash values or similar technical identifiers associated with visual depictions provided in a CyberTipline report or submission to the child victim identification program described in section 404(b)(1)(K)(ii) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11293(b)(1)(K)(ii)) to a non-profit entity for the sole and exclusive purpose of preventing and curtailing the online sexual exploitation of children.

clause.text: in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: by inserting (A) after (1);

by inserting or submission to the child victim identification program described in section 404(b)(1)(K)(ii) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11293(b)(1)(K)(ii)) after CyberTipline report; and

by adding at the end the following: The elements authorized under paragraph (1)(B) shall be limited to hash values or similar technical identifiers associated with visual depictions provided in a CyberTipline report or submission to the child victim identification program described in section 404(b)(1)(K)(ii) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11293(b)(1)(K)(ii)).; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d), by inserting or to the child victim identification program described in section 404(b)(1)(K)(ii) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11293(b)(1)(K)(ii)) after CyberTipline.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 110 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 2258C (as amended by section 6(c)(1)(B) of this Act) and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: “2258C. Use of technical elements from reports made to NCMEC to combat child sexual abuse material.”.

section.header: Eliminating network distribution of child exploitation
section.text: Section 2258A(h) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking 90 days and inserting 1 year; and
by adding at the end the following:

A provider of a report to the CyberTipline may voluntarily preserve the contents provided in the report (including any comingled content described in paragraph (2)) for longer than 1 year after the submission to the CyberTipline for the purpose of reducing the proliferation of online child sexual exploitation or preventing the online sexual exploitation of children.

section.text: If any provision of this Act or any amendment made by this Act, or any application of such provision or amendment to any person or circumstance, is held to be unconstitutional, the remainder of the provisions of this Act and the amendments made by this Act, and the application of the provision or amendment to any other person or circumstance, shall not be affected.
